meanings.definition: Accumulated over time, typically referring to interest or earnings.
meanings.sent1: The accrued interest on my savings account was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent2: The company's accrued profits were reinvested into the business.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her accrued wealth was like a slow-growing money tree.
meanings.sent4: The accrued debt loomed over him like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The accrued snow on the mountain made for a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: Gained or acquired as a result of effort or action.
meanings.sent1: His accrued knowledge from years of studying helped him ace the exam.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their accrued victory after a hard-fought match.
meanings.sent3: She proudly displayed her accrued collection of seashells from various beaches.
meanings.sent4: The accrued skills of the chef shone through in the delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: The accrued experience of the astronaut made her well-prepared for the mission.
